intro: Wahlenbergia oatesii, commonly known as the Oates' bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender, upright stems and narrow, linear leaves. Wahlenbergia oatesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
